overview_summary: All three neighboring landowners have not publicly expressed a clear stance on the proposed development, leaving their positions classified as unknown. None of these individuals holds a notable public office or leadership role, indicating a low level of community influence among the nearby residents.

neighbors.name: Jeffrey Boyce
neighbors.claims: Jeffrey Boyce is a Genesee County landowner and holds no local government position ([townofoakfieldny.gov](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/#:~:text=Melissa%20M,5835%20ext.%20101%20Email%3A%20mhaacke%40townofoakfieldny.com)). He has not been noted in public meetings or local media for any stance on development issues ([townofoakfieldny.gov](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/#:~:text=Melissa%20M,5835%20ext.%20101%20Email%3A%20mhaacke%40townofoakfieldny.com)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a personal, one-on-one approach at his property, emphasizing respect for farmland use and how the project will preserve rural character.

neighbors.name: Brice Johnson
neighbors.claims: Brice Johnson owns a rural parcel in Genesee County and is not known to serve in any public capacity ([townofoakfieldny.gov](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/#:~:text=Melissa%20M,5835%20ext.%20101%20Email%3A%20mhaacke%40townofoakfieldny.com)). There are no public statements or civic activities on record from Johnson regarding local development or energy projects ([townofoakfieldny.gov](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/#:~:text=Melissa%20M,5835%20ext.%20101%20Email%3A%20mhaacke%40townofoakfieldny.com)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact through informal, neighborly conversation, highlighting how the project plans align with preserving farmland and local autonomy.

neighbors.name: Ellen Hersee
neighbors.claims: Ellen Hersee is part of a longstanding farm family in the community ([www.thebatavian.com](https://www.thebatavian.com/obituaries/645939/anne-l-hersee#:~:text=death%20in%20July%202014,more%20than%20thirty%20Elderhostel%20programs)). She holds no local office and has not been publicly involved in development debates ([townofoakfieldny.gov](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/#:~:text=Melissa%20M,5835%20ext.%20101%20Email%3A%20mhaacke%40townofoakfieldny.com)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respectful, face-to-face discussion focusing on the project’s minimal intrusion and assurances that rural peace and farmland value will be maintained.
